name: navigationally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
transport
  specialized in a way that relates to the act of directing a ship, aircraft, etc. from one place to another, or of finding your way from one place to another : The lighthouse is located at the most navigationally important point on the coast. The weather here often causes navigationally hazardous fog banks to form.
internet & telecoms
  specialized in a way that relates to the act of moving around a website or computer screen, or between websites or screens: The website needs to be navigationally clear and child-friendly. The team is testing the new site to make sure that it's navigationally robust.
More examplesFewer examplesThe stars can be navigationally useful for travellers.The vessel did not encounter any navigationally hazardous conditions.
